Postman Testing Guide

API testing helps teams verify whether Synology Office Suite API endpoints, methods, and integrations function as expected.


Step1. Obtain the API Specification

Before testing an API, you need its specification, which outlines the available endpoints, parameters, and methods. Download the API specification for Synology Office Suite packages to explore their API capabilities.

  • Synology Drive
  • Synology Spreadsheet
  • Synology MailPlus
  • Synology Calendar
Step2. Import API Spec to Postman. Get started
Step3. Set Up Testing Environment for desired package
  • Synology Drive / MailPlus / Calendar
  • Synology Spreadsheet
ChatGPT

Enable the Synology Office Suite API plugin in ChatGPT to generate sample code for you and save your time and effort. Get started

/Support/resources/chatgpt.summary: How do I Chat with Synology Office Suite API GPT on ChatGPT?
/Support/resources/chatgpt.description:
Purpose

Synology Office Suite APIs provide developers with powerful tools to automate workflows, enhance productivity, and securely integrate Synology data with third-party platforms through REST APIs and webhook support. To save you time and effort, you can enable the Synology Office Suite API GPT in ChatGPT. It can then search through the Synology Office Suite API documentation, extract relevant parameter formats, and generate sample code for you.

This article provides a guide on getting started with Synology Office Suite API GPT on ChatGPT.


Environment
  • DSM 7.2.2 nano3 or above
  • Synology Drive 3.5.2 version or above
  • Synology Office 3.6.0 version or above
  • Synology MailPlus 3.3.1 version or above
  • Synology Calendar 2.5.3 version or above

Resolution
Start Chat
  1. Click this link to start chatting directly, or sign in to the ChatGPT website, and click on Explore GPTs in the upper left corner.

  2. In the search box, type in Synology Office Suite API.

  3. Select and hit Start Chat.

  4. You can now interact with Synology Office Suite API GPT. Select Keep in sidebar to save the GPT on top.

Example Prompts

Here are some example prompts that illustrate how to interact with the Synology Office Suite API GPT.

  • Automatically download new files uploaded to a shared folder on Synology Drive
    I have created a folder to which team members should upload their weekly reports. How to auto download new files uploaded to this folder?

/Support/resources/postman/import.summary: How to Import an API Specification and Start Testing with Postman
/Support/resources/postman/import.description:
1. Download and install the Postman API Platform by selecting the appropriate version for your operating system.

  2. In the workspace, click Import to import the API spec for the packages you need. If you haven't downloaded it yet, the links are available here

  3. Select Postman Collection and click View Import Settings to check the additional configuration options.

  4. Navigate to Folder Organization and ensure Tags is selected.

  5. Return to the previous page and click Import.

  6. Set up the testing environment for
    • Synology Drive, MailPlus, Calendar
    • Synology Spreadsheet

/Support/resources/postman/setup-others.summary: How to Set Up the Environment for Synology Drive, MailPlus, and Calendar APIs
/Support/resources/postman/setup-others.description:
If you haven't imported the API spec yet, please follow the instructions [here](#docs-/Support/resources/postman/import).
  1. Switch to the Authorization tab and fill in your NAS URL in the baseUrl field.

  2. Hover {{apiKey}} and click Collection to create the variable for this collection.

  3. Go to Authorization > Sign in and switch to Body tab. Fill in account and password. Click Send to retrieve your sid.

  4. Copy the retrieved sid. Fill in the apiKey field in the format of id={sid}.

  5. The apiKey will be applied to all other API endpoints. You can start testing them.

/Support/resources/postman/setup-spreads.summary: How to Set Up the Environment for Spreadsheet APIs
/Support/resources/postman/setup-spreads.description:
If you haven't imported the API spec yet, please follow the instructions [here](#docs-/Support/resources/postman/import).
  1. Switch to the Authorization tab and fill in your Spreadsheet API server URL in the baseUrl field.

  2. Hover {{bearerToken}} and click Collection to create the variable for this collection.

  3. Go to Authorization > Sign in and switch to the Body tab. Fill in username, password, protocol and host for your NAS. Click Send to retrieve your token. For example, if the NAS URL is `https://my-nas:5000`, please fill in `https` for protocol and `my-nas:5000` for host.

  4. Fill in the bearerToken field with the retrieved token.

  5. The token will be applied to all other API endpoints. You can start testing them.
